title: Child shoots himself in the hand with gun
content:
DEKALB COUNTY, Ga. -- A 9-year-old boy was hospitalized after shooting himself in the finger.
It happened at around 1 a.m. Tuesday at a house in the 1900 block of Rollingwood Drive in DeKalb County.
DeKalb County Police Capt. Steven Fore said the boy's mother fell asleep in the living room. According to a police report, as soon as she was asleep, the boy went into his mother's bedroom and climbed onto a step stool to remove a shoe box from a closet shelf. The shoe box contained a .9mm handgun.
"While handling that firearm it discharged, striking him in the finger," said Capt. S.R. Fore, DeKalb County Police's public information officer.
The boy was struck in his left ring finger. He was taken to Children's Healthcare of Atlanta at Scottish Rite with a non-life-threatening injury. A police detective took the weapon as evidence.
The investigation continues. Police have not yet determined whether charges will be filed.
